Scientists say there are two reasons for flash floods like these.
The first is more rain.
Donald Boesch is the former director of the University of Maryland Center for Environmental Science.

As we increase the greenhouse gas concentration, the Earth is heating.

Rain storms are getting more frequent.

The second reason floods are getting worse is that that water has nowhere to go.
We have altered the watersheds so that the water runs off more rapidly - parking lots, roads and subdivisions and roofs.
For every new parking lot or wider road, communities should also build things like storm water retention ponds and larger storm drains.
